title: crit dmg
body: why are talons and and mfs q's increased by crit dmg but ryze, nidalee, karthus not?

replies.body:
Look in the kits its a certain situation that causes it and has just been displayed as a crit.

Like karthus q on a single target or anivias e on a target effected by her r, not actually critically striking just showing that  damage has been modified by the bonus condition.
personally think riot should fix the visuals for clarity why make them act exactly like crits visually but not share all traits of aa crits

Ryze, Nidalee, Karthus, Anivia and more are different situations to what you see with MF, Talon, Draven etc.

With the AD champs they are actual crits, the same as an Auto-attack crit.

With AP spells, what you're seeing is treated like a crit, but it's not actually a crit.
The abilities are given specific scenarios where you can increase their damage, and so their visual representation of this is the same as a crit.
i just dont understand why ie would work with nidalee q but not crit dmg runes
im not sure about viktor but i do know ie works with his q

Viktor's Q is an Auto Attack that's been augmented, it is not a crit at all, you can crit on the auto attack however.

Nidalee's spear does not crit, it has set damage ramp up, IE will not effect it.
her spear never crits, meant cougar form

Well again that's an entirely different situation.
In Cougar form Nidalee's Q is an auto-attack modifier, so again it's the same situation as say Draven's Q and other AA modifiers.

The ability is not criting, the AA underneath the ability is criting.
